data.price: When the sun is wrapped up in darkness,
and when the stars fall down,
and when the mountains are set in motion,
and when pregnant camels[1] are left unattended,
data.footnotes: [1] Which are near delivery. It alludes to the distraction of people from their most valuable possessions, such as ten-month pregnant camels for nomadic Arabs.

data.price: and when wild beasts are gathered,
and when the seas are set on fire,
and when the souls are sorted[2],
data.footnotes: [2] i.e., "joined" with their groups or sects, wicked with the wicked souls, righteous with the righteous.

data.price: and when the baby girl buried alive[3] is asked,
data.footnotes: [3] As the pagan Arabs used to do for fear of shame or poverty. The Qur’an condemned this practice. See 16:58-59.

data.price: for what crime she was killed,
and when records of deeds are spread open,
and when the sky is stripped away[4],
data.footnotes: [4] As the skin of sheep is stripped away.

data.price: and when the Blazing Fire is flared up,
and when Paradise is brought near –
then every soul will know what it has brought about[5].
data.footnotes: [5] Of faith or disbelief, good or bad deeds for that Day.

data.price: I swear by the receding stars,
that rise and hide[6],
data.footnotes: [6] This probably refers to black holes in the sky. "Kanasa" means sweeping or hiding.

data.price: and by the night as it departs,
and by the day as it breaks –
Indeed, this [Qur’an] is a word conveyed by a noble angel-messenger.
extremely powerful, highly revered by the Lord of the Throne,
data.arabic: ذِي قُوَّةٍ عِندَ ذِي ٱلۡعَرۡشِ مَكِينٖ

data.price: obeyed there [by other angels] and trustworthy.
Your fellow [i.e., the Prophet] is not a madman.
He indeed saw him [i.e., Gabriel] on the clear horizon[7].
data.footnotes: [7] i.e., the eastern horizon, where the sun rises. See footnote 53:6

data.price: He does not withhold [knowledge of] the unseen[8].
data.footnotes: [8] He (ﷺ) did not withhold the unseen which Allah had revealed to him in the Qur’an.

data.price: This [Qur’an] is not the word of an accursed devil.
So which way are you going[9]?
data.footnotes: [9] In your denial of the Qur’an for being the revelation from Allah.

data.price: It is but a reminder to the worlds,
for those among you who wish to take the straight path.
But you cannot wish except by the Will of Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
